entry.title: workflow approval process
entry.content:
Hello experts,

 

As we are using Public cloud for creating a purchase request for users we have created a BTP workflow approval before it reaches to SAP .

 

However, after the approval process done from Btp same people have to approve also for purchase order for that it happens double the time and creating kind of double work for approvers.

 

Is there any way that we can restrict the approval process for Purchase requested that comes from only  Btp after approval

entry.title: Outbound delivery DTR not replicated in EWM Public cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

 

I have some users which request to change the stock status with the wrong App.

It creates outbound delivery (type DTR), but some of them where not replicated in EWM.

There is nothing in the queue. 

And in S4, I get the message "Delivery can no longer be changed due to the warehouse processing status"

How I can clear these outbound deliveries ?

Thanks,

Emmanuel.

entry.title: You are not authorized to use transaction FBW3
entry.content:
Hi Expert, 

When I use the app "Post Bills of Exchange Presentation Document", I get the following message "You are not authorized to use transaction FBW3". Am I missing a role? Which one?

Thanks, 

Sabrina

entry.title: Multiple Questions Regarding SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Features for Japanese Manufacturing Company
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
We are currently implementing SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for a Japanese manufacturing company and have several questions regarding standard functionality. We would appreciate your guidance on the following points:

1. ISO20022 Format Support for Foreign Remittance
We currently output remittance data and upload it to the bank's web banking system for foreign payments.

Question: Does the remittance data output support ISO20022 format?


2. Manufacturing Cost Report (Cost of Goods Manufactured Statement)

Question: Is it possible to output a Manufacturing Cost Report as a standard feature?
If not available as standard, what alternative solutions would you recommend (e.g., custom reports, SAP Analytics Cloud, API integration)?


3. Financial Statements Operation for Japanese Companies
We need to understand best practices and localization support for Japanese accounting requirements.
Questions:

Are there Japanese-localized versions of standard financial statements available in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?
How do other Japanese companies typically operate financial statements, including configuration, output methods, and workflows for the following:

Balance Sheet (BS)
Profit & Loss Statement (PL)
Journal Entries (仕訳帳)
General Ledger (総勘定元帳)
Other required financial statements for Japanese GAAP compliance

 


4. Customer Invoice Creation - Transaction Date and PDF Attachment
Regarding customer invoice creation in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud:
① Actual Transaction Date

Current situation (SAP ECC): We can only retrieve and output the "invoice issue date" (document date), not the actual transaction date
Desired requirement: We need to retrieve and output the actual transaction date (the date when the transaction occurred) on customer invoices
This is required under the accrual basis accounting principle
Question: Is it possible to capture and output the actual transaction date in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?

② PDF Document Storage

Question: Can SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud store, manage, and output invoice PDF files as supporting documents/proof of transaction?


Any guidance, documentation links, or best practice recommendations would be greatly appreciated.
Thank you in advance for your support.
Best regards,

entry.title: Difference in Business Partner Tabs Between PRD and TEST system
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are facing a inconsistency between our PRD and TEST environments related to the display of the Business Partner (BP).

Description:

In PRD, when displaying the Business Partner. We can see the tabs Company Codes and Purchasing Organizations under the Business Partner role.

However, in TEST, for the same BP grouping and category, these tabs are tabs are not visible. We only  see the Basic Data, Address, Roles, Bank Accounts, and Attachments are visible.

Could anyone please suggest why there is a difference in the BP tabs display between the PRD and TEST systems?
Thank you

entry.title: Unable to resolve error "Message no. V2127" in Assign Sales document types permitted for sales areas
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I am faced with an issue that "Message no. V2127" cannot be resolved and I am unable to complete configurations in "Assign Sales document types permitted for sales areas" on the Public Cloud system.

I have created a new distribution channel "90" and 1000|90|10 in addition to already existing 1000|10|10.

I have also completed the below configuration afterwards to define 1000|90|10

SSCUI: 102183 Combine Distribution Channels 

However, when creating entries in the "Assign Sales document types permitted for sales areas" (ID: 102185), I receive a message that it is not allowed.

For the provided procedure, there was no changes made to sales org and division so, I only performed the "Combine Distribution Channels" .

Kindly advise me on what I am missing  and how can this be resolved...

Thank you in advance!

Fujita

entry.title: Pipeline procurement error in MIGO (SAP s4hana public cloud)
entry.content:
Hi All,

In pipeline procurement I'm getting the below error during MIGO 201-P movement posting. Pipeline info record also created.
Error - "Balancing field "Profit Center" is not filled in line item 001"

Second error shown below after selecting customizing.

Any help is greatly appreciated.

entry.title: COC Operation: Revaluation of COGS vs. Scrapping Finished product
entry.content: In S4HC Public I have configured in the automatic account determination, for operation VAX/VAY and valuation category "finished product" the account 71201000 (COGS). Since we have actual costing, the COGS will be revaluated with operation COC, in which I have filled the same account. Besides, we have activated the COGS split Based on Cost Components for that account. My doubt is if I post a good issue against cost center because of scrapping (operation GBB-VNG) with account 71200000 (VARIATION INV. FINISHED PRODUCTS), when executing CKMLCP, if there are price differences accumulated, the account 71201000 (COGS) will be posted against the cost center because of COC operation, and a second posting with the COGS splitting will be made. This would be wrong. What should i do if I want to distinguish revaulation of sales to be posted with 71201000 and revaluation of consumption against cost center with 71200000 (and therefore no splitting), when I can only fill one account in the automatic account determination for the combination of operation COC and valuation category "finished product"?

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud_Payment Media file contains no data
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I encountered an issue while running an automatic payment in SAP S/4HANA (Public Cloud). The payment medium file was generated successfully using the payment medium format /JP_ZENGINKYO (which is copied from JP_ZENGINKYO), but the output file is blank (contains no data).

Could anyone please advise how to resolve this issue?
Any guidance on configuration steps or example setups would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: With reference to PO how to create auto GRN using background job in sap public cloud(3SL)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working in an SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3-System Landscape) environment, and I have a requirement to automatically post Goods Receipt (GRN) with reference to a Purchase Order using a scheduled/background job.

In standard SAP Public Cloud, we already have the “Schedule Goods Receipt for Inbound Deliveries” job, but in my case the business requirement is to post GR directly from the Purchase Order (without using Inbound Delivery).

If anyone has implemented a similar solution in 3SL—such as creating a RAP background job, using a released API, or integrating through the Material Documents API—please share your experience or guidance.

Thank you!

entry.title: Guidance for Creating Sales Order from External System to SAP Public Cloud Using CPI
entry.content:
Hi SAP Exports,

I am currently working on creating a sales order from an external system dynamically. While going through various blogs and videos, I was unable to find a complete and proper document that clearly explains how to create the sales order from an external system and access the data through Postman using JSON Web Token (JWT) or OAuth 2.0 authentication.

Could you please guide me on:

  • Which authentication method (JWT or OAuth 2.0) is easier to implement for this scenario?

  • The step-by-step process to create the sales order, starting from the external system up to testing in Postman.

  • How to handle the payload and mapping of fields.

I have already created the communication arrangements and am using the standard API from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub (A2X). However, I am currently stuck at the field mapping and payload creation stage.

Additionally, could you please clarify whether Groovy scripts are required for creating the sales order dynamically, and which approach is recommended — hardcoding or dynamic creation?

Thank you very much for your time and guidance.

entry.title: BAdI that allows modification of standard fields in the production order header
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we would like to modify the order header information in the production order at the time of release, in our case, to indicate the batch at the header level that we want to use. We do not want to create a new batch, we want to automatically indicate an existing batch.

We have only found Badis that allow us to modify custom fields but not standard fields.

There is the BAdI BD_MFGORDER_CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE, but it only allows checks to be performed.In SAP S/4HANNA On premise, we have the BAdI WORKORDER_UPDATE, which allows logic to be added to the production order.

Is there a BAdI that allows us to define logic for the information specified in the standard fields of the production order header?

Thanks!

entry.title: How to extract BOM Explosion and Configuration details for Sales Order Items into SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently working on exporting BOM explosion data for Sales Order items into SAP Datasphere.

Our goal is to replicate the same level of detail available in transaction VA03 (Display Sales Order) — specifically when selecting an item, navigating to Item Details → Configuration, and choosing "Bill of Material" as the configurable item.

We have verified that there are no released or available CDS Views in S4HANA Public Cloud covering the standard SAP tables required to replicate this logic, such as:

  • CUOB – Assignment of Object to Dependency

  • CUKN – Dependency Storage (Variants/Configuration)

  • IBIN – IBase Components – Condition

  • IBINVALUES – IBase Components – Condition Characteristic Evaluation

  • IBSYMBOL – Characteristic Value Assignment

  • CABN – Characteristic

We also explored the Sales Order – Simulate (A2X) API as a potential source, since it exposes variant configuration details through the _VariantConfiguration/_Instance association.
However, when trying to consume this API in SAP Datasphere, that association and its detailed data are not accessible.

Our questions:

  1. How can we import these specific configuration / BOM explosion details into SAP Datasphere?

  2. Are there any other APIs or CDS Views providing access to this data?

  3. Is there any recommended approach or best practice to achieve this kind of replication?

Any insight, workaround, or experience with similar requirements would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your help

entry.title: Image upload in Public cloud
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am trying to upload image attachments for product master data using the Migrate Your Data – Migration Cockpit with the Document Info Record (DIR) migration object. However, during the simulation step, I encountered the following error message:

"Active repository must be Document Management Service in Cloud Foundry environment."

Please help me understand the root cause of this issue and guide me on how to configure the system correctly so that image attachments can be uploaded successfully using the Migration Cockpit.

Best Regards,

Dinesh U

entry.title: It’s not clear which changes need to be finalized before RITA can be activated - S4H Public Cloud
entry.content:
For one of the companies in France we are planning to activate RITA and create plants in 3 countries. The documentation mentions that all country specific changes must be finalized before migrating to RITA and no configuration project should remain open during RITA activation. However, it does not specify which changes these are.

1) SAP Help claims: 
(..)Ensure that you have no open transports pertaining to any country/region that you would use as either the company code country/region or the foreign registration country/region. Complete any transports involving content for any such country/region in any system that you use for testing and in your production system before initiating the migration to RITA. Additionally, if you later activate any additional country/region versions, ensure that all relevant transports are fully complete before performing any RITA-related configuration or maintenance(...)

2) SNOTE: 2907372  

(...)RITA activation is possible only if all business configuration projects have been released. Activating RITA with open business configuration projects prevents the subsequent transport of content to your production system. This can cause potentially serious inconsistencies.(...)

 

  1. Could you point out specifically what changes are considered are country-specific in terms of RITA activation?
  2. What exactly do we mean by the term 'configuration project is released'?

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Localization  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Finance

entry.title: Issue with Budget Display in "Monitor Project" App – SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (R&D)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m currently working on Project Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
I successfully created a project with WBS elements and uploaded the financial planning data using the app “Import Financial Plan Data.”

The import was executed successfully, and I can see the budget assigned to each WBS element correctly in the Financial Plan Data Report.

However, when I open the “Monitor Project” app to check the budget assigned to the project, the values are not displayed — it seems that the budget is not visible or not linked to the project in that app.

My question:
Is there any customizing step or configuration I might have missed to make the imported financial plan visible in the “Monitor Project” app?
Do I need to perform any activation, version release, or mapping step between the financial plan and the project structure?

Thank you in advance for your help and insights!

Best regards,
